snippet: New orders for factory goods rose slightly and the pace of growth in the services sector slowed for a second consecutive month in December.
abstract: Institute for Supply Management says its index of nonmanufacturing activity fell to 53 in December from 53.9 in November; Commerce Department says new orders for factory goods rose 1.8 in percent in November; orders for durable goods rose 3.4 percent.
lead_paragraph: New orders for factory goods rose slightly and the pace of growth in the services sector slowed for a second consecutive month in December.

headline.main: U.S. Growth Continues, But the Pace Slows a Bit
headline.print_headline: U.S. Growth Continues, But the Pace Slows a Bit
